thread.title: West Ham Upsets Arsenal with 2-0 Victory – Premier League Day 19 Update
thread.title_full: West Ham Upsets Arsenal with 2-0 Victory – Premier League Day 19 Update

author: world today news
title: West Ham Upsets Arsenal with 2-0 Victory – Premier League Day 19 Update
text:
December 28, 2023 – 17:25
At the moment West Ham is sixth in the Premier League with 33 points Photo_Reuters
West Ham surprised Arsenal and took away three valuable points, after winning 2-0 at the Emirates Stadium, within the day 19 of the Premier League.
You might be interested: Old Trafford was reached by modernity. It could be demolished!
The setback, which was combined with a victory for Liverpool against Burnley, took first place from the Gunners who were left with 40 points compared to 42 of those led by Jürgen Klopp.
Mexican Edson Álvarez played the entire match; The footballer had a good performance in recovering balls, in the defensive sector, in addition to contributing to the arrival of the visiting team.
The hammers opened the scoring at minute 13′. The defense was unable to clear a cross, the ball fell to Jarrod Bowen who left it to Tomáš Souček who, on the edge of the six-yard box, sent a right foot to make it 1-0.

The second fell in the complement; James Ward-Prowse sent in a corner kick and Konstantinos Mavropanos headed home with an accurate header. victory over David Raya in the 55′.
ARSENAL TRIED TO COME BACK BUT WEST HAM SURPRISED THE GUNNERS
Arsenal tried to react, in fact, they advanced ranks in search of getting closer on the scoreboard, but it lacked forcefulness.

The visit closed spaces and although he made some oversights in the lower partArsenal did not capitalize on them, keeping the score at zero.
The victory allowed West Ham place in sixth position in the Premier League. Los Hammers suman 33 points after achieving his tenth victory of the season.
Football in England does not stop and there will be games on the weekend; On Sunday, December 31, Arsenal will visit Raúl Jiménez’s Fulham, while West Ham will host Brightonin a commitment that will take place on January 2.
